title: Crossing the Bridge
devotional:
The old wooden bridge was rickety, but it was the only way to cross the deep ravine. Sarah had promised to bring warm soup to her neighbor, Mr. Henderson, who was recovering from a bad fall. The ingredients were simple: carrots, potatoes, chicken broth – but the love stirred into the recipe was what truly made it healing. As she approached the bridge, the wind howled, and the planks groaned under her weight. Fear gnawed at her, but the image of Mr. Henderson's grateful smile spurred her onward.

Sacrifice isn't always grand or dramatic. It often manifests in the small, everyday acts of selflessness. It's choosing to inconvenience ourselves for the benefit of others, even when it's uncomfortable or risky. Jesus modeled this perfectly for us. He left the splendor of Heaven and embraced humanity, enduring suffering and ultimately sacrificing His life on the cross for our salvation. This wasn't a casual act; it was the ultimate expression of love, a complete and total giving of Himself.

True sacrifice isn't about seeking recognition or reward. It's about a sincere desire to alleviate suffering, offer comfort, or share what we have with those in need. It's about putting aside our own desires and priorities to meet the needs of others. Think about the widow who gave her two small copper coins (Luke 21:1-4). Jesus commended her because she gave out of her poverty, putting in everything she had to live on. Her sacrifice, though seemingly insignificant, was profound because it came from a place of deep trust and devotion.

What are we being called to sacrifice today? It might be our time, our resources, our comfort, or even our pride. Perhaps it's forgiving someone who has wronged us, offering a listening ear to a friend in need, or volunteering our skills to a worthy cause. Whatever it may be, let us remember that true sacrifice is an act of love, rooted in the example of Christ. It’s not about what we give up, but about what we make possible for others through our giving.

Like Sarah crossing the rickety bridge, we may face obstacles and fears when we choose to sacrifice. But the reward of knowing that we have made a difference in someone's life, and that we have honored God through our actions, is a treasure beyond measure. Let's embrace the opportunity to live sacrificially, knowing that in giving, we truly receive.
image_description: A rustic wooden bridge spanning a snow-covered ravine. Bare trees are visible in the background and a hint of sunlight breaks through the clouds.
insights: Jesus' teaching in Matthew 16:24-25, 'If anyone would come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me. For whoever would save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for my sake will find it,' highlights the paradox of sacrifice. It's through giving up our own desires and ambitions that we truly find life, both here on earth and in eternity. The act of sacrifice aligns our hearts with God's will and allows us to experience the fullness of His love.
prayer: Lord Jesus, thank you for your ultimate sacrifice on the cross, demonstrating the depth of your love for us. Help me to see the opportunities around me to live more sacrificially. Give me the courage to step out of my comfort zone and offer my time, resources, and talents to those in need. May my acts of sacrifice be a reflection of your love and a testament to your grace. Amen.
reflection: What small, everyday sacrifices can you make to better serve those around you? What fears or obstacles are preventing you from living more sacrificially? How can you shift your perspective to see sacrifice not as a loss, but as an opportunity to experience God's love and grace?
